result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary L Rimaricik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Release date December 8, 2016. Defendant is eligible for the substance abuse program and for the challenge incarceration program.
Concurrent with: Polk County Cases: 13CF205 and 13CF243

records.addlTxt: 04:21 Defendant Zachary L Rimaricik in court with attorney Alex Stormont.  Defendant Zachary L. Rimaricik in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan--defendant plead guilty to count 1 in information, 1 year jail, credit 54 days, release Decemeber 8, 2016 w/good time concurrent to a prision sentence he is currently serving.  Parties agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Defendant has not been in the armed services.  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 1 in the information.   Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty. O'Sullivan and Stormont address the court. Court Orders: defendant to serve 1 year in the county jail with 54 days credit for time served, release date December 8, 2016, concurrent with sentence in Polk County (Polk County case nos. 13CF205, 13CF243)  , JOC to state "defendant is eligible for the substance abuse program and for the challenge incarceration program." Defendant will be in custody in Polk County and sent to Dodge at some time.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 04:37
to reschedule plea hearing until after sentencing after revocation hearing in Polk County filed by Atty Stormot.
Plea hearing on May 2, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Plea hearing on May 2, 2016 at 04:00 pm.  *Defendant copy mailed to Polk County Jail.
Plea hearing at 04-04-2016 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference at 02-08-2016 03:00 pm.
Defendant's and Motion filed by Atty Stormont
State's
Pre-trial conference at 01-11-2016 02:15 pm.

Def pleas not guilty to charge. Court:NG plea is entered. OSullivan: this will be set 4 months out: Def offered an ATR through probation. Court: if released on his ATR, Def is on a signature bond. Goes over bond conditions with Def.

4:22 Defendant Zachary L Rimaricik in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears via phone. OSullivan requests warrant be quashed. Court quashes warrant.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and maximum penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights,  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. OSullivan: $3000 sign bond. OSullivan moves to amend the spelling of the Def's last name: Rimarcik. Nelson has not objection to bond or motion to correct name. Court grants motion to amend def's last name. Def does not qualify for the PD. Def has not been in the armed services.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Booking Sheet from PCJ
